data.text:
Mike Wallace invented news as it is today. In the 1950s everything was bland. Interviews never dared to ask a question that was not blaaaand and he started asking hard questions, real questions, uncovering real news.

He was a showman, he wasn’t just a news guy or a journalist; he had a sharp and inquiring mind, and he was trying to find his way, to find a platform from which he could perform. He was a showman and he made news into a show. And he was responsible for the nonsense news we hear today.
